QEI_Velo
[QEI]


Defines

#define VIRTUAL_QEI_SIGNAL   1
#define SIGNAL_MODE   0
#define CAP_MODE   1
#define CAP_PERIOD   250000UL
#define DISP_TIME   3000000UL
#define MAX_CAP_TIMES   (DISP_TIME/CAP_PERIOD)
#define ENC_RES   2048UL
#define MAX_VEL   600UL
#define COUNT_MODE   4
#define PHASE_A_PIN   (1<<19)
#define PHASE_B_PIN   (1<<21)

Functions

void VirtualQEISignal_Init (void)
 Initializes signal supplying for QEI peripheral by using timer match interrupt output, that will generate two virtual signal on Phase-A and Phase-B. These two clock are 90 degrees out of phase. In this case, a 'virtual encoder' that has these following parameter:
  • Encoder type : Quadrature encoder
  • Max velocity : MAX_VEL (Round Per Minute)
  • Encoder Resolution : ENC_RES (Pulse Per Round) The calculated frequency is: Freq = (MAX_VEL * ENC_RES * COUNT_MODE) / 60 (Hz) The timer therefore should be set to tick every cycle T = 1/Freq (second) Figure: |-----| |-----| Phase A --| |-----| |----- |-----| |-----| Phase B -----| |-----| |--.

void TIMER0_IRQHandler (void)
 Timer 0 interrupt handler. This sub-routine will set/clear two Phase A-B output pin to their phase state.
void QEI_IRQHandler (void)
 QEI interrupt handler. This sub-routine will update current value of captured velocity in to velocity accumulate.
int c_entry (void)
 c_entry: Main QEI program body
int main (void)
void check_failed (uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)

Define Documentation

#define CAP_MODE   1

Capture Mode setting:

  • When = 0, only PhA edges are counted (2X).
  • When = 1, BOTH PhA and PhB edges are counted (4X), increasing resolution but decreasing range

Definition at line 84 of file qei_test_velo.c.

#define SIGNAL_MODE   0

Signal Mode setting:

  • When = 0, PhA and PhB function as quadrature encoder inputs.
  • When = 1, PhA functions as the direction signal and PhB functions as the clock signal

Definition at line 50 of file qei_test_velo.c.

#define VIRTUAL_QEI_SIGNAL   1

In case of using QEI virtual signal, this macro below must be set to 1

Definition at line 73 of file usbdmain.c.

void VirtualQEISignal_Init ( void   ) 

Initializes signal supplying for QEI peripheral by using timer match interrupt output, that will generate two virtual signal on Phase-A and Phase-B. These two clock are 90 degrees out of phase. In this case, a 'virtual encoder' that has these following parameter:

  • Encoder type : Quadrature encoder
  • Max velocity : MAX_VEL (Round Per Minute)
  • Encoder Resolution : ENC_RES (Pulse Per Round) The calculated frequency is: Freq = (MAX_VEL * ENC_RES * COUNT_MODE) / 60 (Hz) The timer therefore should be set to tick every cycle T = 1/Freq (second) Figure: |-----| |-----| Phase A --| |-----| |----- |-----| |-----| Phase B -----| |-----| |--.

|--|--|--|--|--|--|--|-- T T T T T T T

Parameters:
[in] None 
Returns:
None

Definition at line 226 of file qei_test_velo.c.

Variable Documentation

__IO uint8_t PhaseCnt

Phase Counter:

  • 0: Phase A = 1, Phase B = 0
  • 1: Phase A = 1, Phase B = 1
  • 2: Phase A = 0, Phase B = 1
  • 3: Phase A = 0, Phase B = 0
